snippet: A state agency said the forestry division put the protection of property ahead of the safety of firefighters.
abstract: Arizona safety commission issues fines totaling $559,000 against the Arizona State Forestry Division, saying agency put firefighters in unnecessary danger while battling wildfires in summer of 2013; contends that understaffing and weak leadership contributed to deaths of 19 members of the Granite Mountain Hotshots.
lead_paragraph: A state agency said the forestry division put the protection of property ahead of the safety of firefighters.

headline.main: Arizona Agency Is Faulted in Deaths of Firefighters
headline.print_headline: Agency Put Firefighters in Danger, Board Finds
